p: In a recent report, evidence of intravenous drug use (IDU) was reported in 179 of 206 countries or territories. Among an estimated 15.6 million people who inject drugs (PWID), 3.2 (1.6â€“5.1) million are women. The percentage of women who inject drugs (WWID) varies substantially across regions, ranging from 3.1% to 33% of all PWID [ 1]. The prevalence of IDU among men is far higher than in women in all regions.
